The Node.js code provided is a module that exports various functionalities related to AWS Security Token Service (STS) by re-exporting modules from different files using TypeScript. It serves as a single entry point for importing STS-related functionalities into other parts of a codebase. The code uses `tslib` to handle TypeScript's module exports in a compact fashion. Here's the code rewritten with the same functionality:

```javascript
"use strict";
Object.defineProperty(exports, "__esModule", { value: true });

exports.STSClient = require("./STSClient");
exports.STS = require("./STS");
exports.AssumeRoleCommand = require("./commands/AssumeRoleCommand");
exports.AssumeRoleWithSAMLCommand = require("./commands/AssumeRoleWithSAMLCommand");
exports.AssumeRoleWithWebIdentityCommand = require("./commands/AssumeRoleWithWebIdentityCommand");
exports.DecodeAuthorizationMessageCommand = require("./commands/DecodeAuthorizationMessageCommand");
exports.GetAccessKeyInfoCommand = require("./commands/GetAccessKeyInfoCommand");
exports.GetCallerIdentityCommand = require("./commands/GetCallerIdentityCommand");
exports.GetFederationTokenCommand = require("./commands/GetFederationTokenCommand");
exports.GetSessionTokenCommand = require("./commands/GetSessionTokenCommand");
exports.models = require("./models/index");

//# sourceMappingURL=index.js.map
```
